item_title: CALL TO ORDER, ROLL CALL & TRIBAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_title: Legislative Report
subitem_blurb: Status report and possible action on pending legislation. (KH/SC-SF)

subitem_title: Informational Briefing on Smart Growth
subitem_blurb: Staff briefing on the topic of smart growth as it relates to the Coastal Act and a pending resource document for Commission staff and local government staff. (BC-SF)

subitem_title: Sustainability Principles
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and possible Commission action on “Sustainability Principles: A Framework for Reducing Greenhouse Gas Emissions in the Coastal Zone.” (BC-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0674 (City of Avalon, Los Angeles Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of the City of Avalon to conduct pier repair and maintenance activities within 5-year time period (2023-2028). Proposed activities to include: replace timber piles, pile caps, wrap existing piles with fiberglass jacket pile wrap, replace timber braces and replace decking on entire length of pier. Maintenance and repairs will not expand existing development past its existing permitted configuration and specifications at Green Pleasure Pier in Avalon Harbor, Catalina Island, Los Angeles County. (MR-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Arcata office at (707) 826-8950.

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-1-FTB-23-0002 (Caltrans, Fort Bragg)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Jacob Patterson and Annemarie Weibel of decision of City of Fort Bragg granting permit with conditions to Caltrans to construct the Fort Bragg ADA Improvement Project along Highway 1 (Main Street) between Highway 20 (post mile 59.80) and Elm Street (PM 62.10) to improve transportation corridor consistent with Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) standards, Fort Bragg, Mendocino County. (AS-A)
subitem_status: SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 1-23-0136 (Sequoia Forest Products, LLC, Eureka)
subitem_blurb: Application of Sequoia Forest Products LLC to improve lumber mill facility, to include interior improvements to existing structure, septic and electrical improvements, and demolition of existing structures at Brainard remanufacturing facility, 5151 Highway 101, Eureka, Humboldt County. (TRG-A)

item_title: DEPUTY DIRECTOR’S REPORT for ENERGY, OCEAN RESOURCES and FEDERAL CONSISTENCY
item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.
subitem_title: Poseidon Carlsbad Desalination Mitigation Program
subitem_blurb: Possible Commission action on a proposed amendment to the current 2022-2023 Work Plan and Budget to extend it for one month, through August 2023. The Work Plan and Budget is for the technical oversight and independent monitoring under the Poseidon Carlsbad Desalination mitigation program required as a condition of Permit No. E-06-013 (Poseidon Resources (Channelside) LP), San Diego County. (AB-SF) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: City of Santa Barbara LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-SBC-23-0024-1 (ADU Update)
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Santa Barbara to amend the Implementation Plan portion of its certified LCP to add provisions relating to Accessory Dwelling Units to conform to new state law requirements is de minimis. (JH-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-4-STB-22-0013 (G & K Farms, Santa Barbara Co.)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Sarah Trigueiro from decision of County of Santa Barbara granting permit with conditions to G & K Farms to construct 25,418 sq.ft., 25-ft. tall cannabis processing building and detention basin, installation of two emergency generators and ten 3,450 gallon water tanks, and grading consisting of 1,400 cu. yds. of cut and 1,000 cu. yds. of fill at 3561 Foothill Rd. in the Carpinteria area, Santa Barbara County. (MK-V)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report For Los Angeles County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Manhattan Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-MNB-22-0028-1
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Manhattan Beach to amend the certified LUP to add a new Coastal Hazards section/chapter to the LUP; the new section titled Section VI: Coastal Hazards is informed by the City’s 2021 Sea Level Rise Adaptation Plan and contains information regarding current and future coastal hazards including flooding and beach erosion hazards and introduces all new coastal hazards and adaptation policies for Manhattan Beach, Los Angeles County. (LR-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0873 (City of Santa Monica, Santa Monica)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Santa Monica for after-the-fact request to approve parking rate increases of all city-owned parking facilities in the Coastal Zone, request to authorize all future rate changes (up or down subject to city’s uncertified municipal code requirements) for period of five years, in the Coastal Zone of the City of Santa Monica. (VL-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

item_blurb: At a convenient time during the meeting, the Commission (CCC) will have a closed session to discuss items of pending litigation, including:

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0969 (Frye Family Partnership, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Frye Family Partnership (Attn: Robert Davis) to remove 420 sq. ft. pier, 3 ft. x 17 ft. gangway, and seven pier T-piles, and construct new 335 sq.ft. pier, 3 ft. x 24 ft. gangway, and four 14-in. T-piles; existing 144 sq.ft. pier platform to remain and be relocated. No work is proposed to the 240 sq. ft. floating dock at 1404 South Bay Front, Newport Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0970 (Shore Investors IV, LLC, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Shore Investors IV, LLC to remove 541 sq.ft. floating dock supported by three (3) 12-in. round piles and replace with 500 sq.ft. floating dock supported by three (3) 12-in. round piles. One 3 ft. x 20 ft. (60 sq.ft.) gangway will be replaced with new 3 ft. x 24 ft. (72 sq.ft.) gangway; existing cantilevered deck will remain in place, at 760 Harbor Island Drive, Newport Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0904 (Velarde, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of George Velarde to remove an existing 394 sq. ft. floating dock, 3 ft. x 24 ft. gangway, and two 14-in. concrete marina guide piles, and construct a new 371 sq. ft. floating dock, 3 ft. x 20 ft. gangway, and three 14-in marine guide piles. No work is proposed to the existing 400 sq. ft. pier at 214 Via Lido Nord, Newport Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0020 (Jones, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Renate Jones to remove 920 sq.ft. floating dock, 344 sq.ft. of which is unpermitted, and construct new 825 sq.ft. floating dock, with three 14-in. guide piles and 3 ft. x 16 ft. gangway at 16192 Wayfarer Lane, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0995 (Segerstrom Properties, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Segerstrom Properties to remove an existing boat dock comprised of a 649 sq. ft., “U” shaped float, 3 ft. x 20 ft. gangway; 8 ft. x 10 ft. pier platform, two 14-inch “T” piles, and four 15-inch guide piles; and replace with a new boat dock comprised of a 477 sq. ft., “U” shaped float, new 3 ft. x 20 ft. gangway; 10 ft. x 14 ft. pier platform; 4 ft. x 4½ ft. pier; two new 14-inch “T” piles, and three new 14-inch diameter guide piles at 818 West Bay Ave., Newport Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Chief of Enforcement on Statewide Enforcement Program. (LAH-SF)

subitem_title: City of Capitola LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-CAP-23-0026-1 (Public Parking Rates/Zones)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing to determine whether the Commission concurs with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Capitola to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan to modify the LCP’s provisions related to parking rates and zones is de minimis, and thus should be approved as submitted, and if the Commission objects to such determination, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (KF-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Santa Cruz County LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-SCO-22-0033-1 (Wireless Facilities Provisions)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by Santa Cruz County to amend the LCP Implementation Plan to modify the County’s existing wireless facilities provisions for conformance with current federal and state law, and if the Commission does not take a final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (NC-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Carmel-by-the-Sea LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-CML-23-0022-1-Part B (Timeshare Provisions)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by City of Carmel-by-the-Sea to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan to clarify existing timeshare regulations, and if the Commission does not take a final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (MF-SC)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-3-STC-23-0019 (Reed ADU, Santa Cruz)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Yossi Vinograd from decision by City of Santa Cruz granting permit to Daniel and Terry Reed to construct detached ground floor garage and second floor accessory dwelling unit on roughly 16,000 sq.ft. parcel at 534 West Cliff Drive in the City of Santa Cruz in Santa Cruz County. (KF-SC)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-3-SLO-23-0020 (Dick SFD, Los Osos)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Los Osos Sustainability Group (LOSG) from decision by San Luis Obispo County granting permit to Roger Dick to construct a 1,910 square-foot single-family residence with attached two-car garage on a vacant lot at 1153 11th Street in the unincorporated community of Los Osos in San Luis Obispo County. (DJ-SC)
subitem_status: SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND, de Novo Hearing CONTINUED

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-NPB-23-0020-2 (Fractional Ownership).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing to determine whether the Commission concurs with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by City of Newport Beach to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan to clarify that Fractional Ownership uses are defined as a Time Share use within the City of Newport Beach and to make minor cleanup revision to existing time share regulations is de minimis and thus should be approved as submitted, and if the Commission objects to such determination, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-EMB-23-0023 (Olson, Emerald Bay, Orange Co.)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Neel and Sharlene Grover of decision granting permit with conditions to Steve Olson to demolish an existing 2,500 sq. ft. single family residence and construct a new 5,750 sq. ft., 3-level single family residence with a three- car garage at 52 Emerald Bay in the unincorporated Emerald Bay area of Orange County. (MV-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0337 (City of Newport Beach, CDFW, & Newport Bay Conservancy, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Newport Beach, California Department of Fish and Wildlife, and Newport Bay Conservancy for Phase 3 of Big Canyon Restoration Project, to include restoration of historic tidal influence, installation of transitional native habitats, and removal of invasive species and selenium contamination, at Big Canyon Nature Preserve in Newport Beach, Orange County. (CS-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Revocation No. A-5-DPT-22-0038-REV (City of Dana Point, Dana Point)
subitem_blurb: Request by Toni Nelson and Roger Malcolm to revoke permit granted by the Commission to the City of Dana Point to establish a Short-Term Rental (STR) Program to regulate permitting and operation for STRs within the Coastal Zone of the City of Dana Point, Orange County. (SA-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-22-0023-1 (2020 Code Update).
subitem_blurb: Commission action on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program with the 2020 update to various chapters of the Land Development Code consisting of a variety of changes and corrections. (AL-SD)

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-22-0025-1 (2021 Code Update).
subitem_blurb: Commission action on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program with the 2021 update to various chapters of the Land Development Code consisting of a variety of changes and corrections. (AL-SD)

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-22-0064-3 (Community Planning Group Reform).
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program Land Development Code (IP) to reflect the legal status of community planning groups as independent agencies is de minimis. (AL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of National City LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-NLC-23-0012-1 (Balanced Land Use Plan) Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 90-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the request by City of National City to amend its Land Use Plan to remove 12.4 acres of land that has been transferred to the San Diego Unified Port District and redesignate five City-owned parcels from Medium Manufacturing to Tourist Commercial. (ML-SD)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-6-DMR-23-0022 (Vonder Reith, Del Mar)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Gwynn Thomas, Jeff Sturgis, Laura Schaefer, Lois Lund, James Wood, and Holley Martens from decision of City of Del Mar granting permit to Mary S. Vonder Reith to demolish 239 sq. ft. of existing duplex; construct new detached two-story 1,000 sq. ft. accessory dwelling unit on an 8,000 sq. ft. lot with an existing 2,433 sq. ft. multi-story duplex, and 525 sq. ft. detached garage, at 118 and 120 6th Street, Del Mar, San Diego County. (SL-SD)
subitem_status: SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND, de Novo Hearing CONTINUED
